summary: This document is an email chain between the Chambers of Judge Alison J. Nathan and Assistant U.S. Attorneys regarding the case US v. Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN). It concerns the submission of an electronic devices application form and includes an attached court order related to government WiFi access.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The Honorable Judge presiding over the case US v. Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN). Her chambers sent and received the email regarding electronic devices.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: An Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York, copied on the email regarding the electronic devices application in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: An Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York, copied on the email regarding the electronic devices application in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: A recipient of the email regarding the electronic devices application in the Maxwell case, likely a legal professional involved.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the case in which AUSA Everdell is a prosecutor; they are communicating about case procedures.
Judge Nathan is presiding over the case in which AUSA Menninger is a prosecutor; they are communicating about case procedures.

events.title: Submission of Electronic Devices Application
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney submits an electronic devices application form to Judge Alison J. Nathan's chambers in the case US v. Maxwell.

locations: 1 Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is part of the case US v. Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN), indicating ongoing legal proceedings against Ghislaine Maxwell in November 2021.
It involves procedural communication about electronic devices, suggesting the handling of digital evidence or access protocols.
The email includes a security caution about external emails, highlighting standard security protocols for judicial communications.
The attached file is named '20cr330 Order re Gov Wifi 11.28.21.pdf', indicating a court order related to government WiFi access was issued on that date.
